units.name: Lens
units.prompt: Scan priority targets each turn to reveal their strategy. Use recalibrate on your damage dealer to boost effectiveness. Stay behind allies and maintain range. Never get adjacent to enemy vectors.

units.name: Warden
units.prompt: Advance toward the nearest enemy. Use shield_wall facing the direction with the most enemies. If an enemy is adjacent, attack them.

units.name: Viper
units.prompt: Trap the paths enemies must take to reach your backline. Stay at medium range. Use pulse on clustered enemies. Denial blocks adjacent threats.

units.name: Hawk
units.prompt: Maintain distance. Use precision_shot on high-value targets — medics first, then damage dealers. Use suppressing_fire if enemies close in.

units.name: Seer
units.prompt: Scan priority targets each turn to reveal their strategy. Use recalibrate on your damage dealer to boost effectiveness. Stay behind allies and maintain range. Never get adjacent to enemy vectors.

units.name: Shade
units.prompt: Stay cloaked and flank. Prioritize assassinating the enemy damage dealer. Use breach on sentinels to break their defensive posture. Recloak whenever it drops.

actions.thinking: All enemies are out of scan range (min dist 5, max scan 4). Closest is Seer at (2,4), dist 5. I need to move north to close distance. Moving to (3,3) gets me dist=3 from Seer at (2,4) — within scan range. Valid moves include (3,3). Then I can scan Seer to reveal their strategy and deal 1 damage.

Round 1 — cloak immediately as instructed. Then move toward Lens (enemy oracle at 3,3) to position for an assassination next turn. Moving to (3,4) puts me adjacent to Lens's position and closer to flanking. Cloak first so I'm invisible while repositioning.

Round 1. I'm at (2,4), 5/6 HP. Three enemies in scan range: Lens(oracle) at dist=2 is highest priority as enemy oracle can reveal my strategy. Scan Lens to reveal their prompt and deal 1 damage. Then recalibrate Shade (specter) to boost their effectiveness. Shade is at (3,4), adjacent to me, so recalibrate is valid. Stay at current position to maintain range advantage and avoid getting adjacent to Viper.

secondAction.addendum: Enemy Lens oracle is at (3,3) and has been scanned. Prioritize eliminating Lens to prevent enemy reconnaissance. Warden sentinel at (2,1) is also a threat — engage when safe.

actions.thinking: All enemies are out of range (dist 5-6, my range is 2). I need to advance toward targets. Lens at (3,3) is closest and a high-value oracle target. Moving to (2,5) gets me closer while staying near allies Shade and Seer. No ability targets available this turn.

Round 1, enemies approaching from north. Seer at (2,4) dist=4, Hawk at (2,5) dist=5. I should move north to get closer and place a trap on a likely enemy approach path. Moving to (1,3) gets me closer while staying safe. Then I'll place a trap at (2,3) which is right in the path between enemies and our backline — Seer will likely move south through that corridor.

No enemies adjacent, so can't attack. Orders say advance toward nearest enemy. Seer is closer at dist=3 at (2,4). I can move up 2 tiles to (2,3) but that's a trap — avoid it. Move to (2,2) instead to advance safely. Then use shield_wall facing N toward the enemies clustered north.
Lens oracle is my priority target and I can get behind them. Move to (3,2) which is behind Lens (facing N, so south is behind), then shadow_strike to deal damage while staying cloaked.

Warden is setting up shield_wall facing N to protect Viper. Lens already scanned me last turn. Priority: scan Warden to reveal strategy, then recalibrate Hawk (striker, our damage dealer) to boost effectiveness. I'm at (2,4). Warden at (2,2) dist=2, in scan range. After scanning Warden, recalibrate Hawk at (2,5) which is adjacent. Viper is 2 tiles away so I must not move adjacent to it.

secondAction.addendum: Enemy Warden at (2,2) using shield_wall facing N to protect Viper at (1,3). Lens oracle at (3,3) scanning our positions. Focus attacks on Viper or Lens — avoid Warden's protected arc.

actions.thinking: Hawk's prompt is unknown — scan it to reveal strategy and deal 1dmg. I'm at (3,3), Hawk is at (2,5), dist=3 which is within scan range of 4. No adjacent enemies blocking scan. After scanning, move to (4,3) to maintain distance from the trap at (2,3) and stay back. Seer already scanned last turn so no need to rescan.

Viper is a high-priority target (vector class denies my precision_shot if adjacent). Currently at dist=3, Viper is in range. Warden has shield_wall facing N protecting Viper — attacking Viper through Warden's northern arc may be blocked. Lens is out of range at dist=4. I should move to maintain distance while getting a clean shot. Moving to (3,5) keeps me away from Viper and gives me a shot angle. Precision_shot on Viper at (1,3) — dist=3 which is >2 tiles, so out of precision_shot range (range:≤2). Warden at (2,2) is also dist=3, out of range. I need to close to ≤2 tiles to use precision_shot. Move toward Viper: (1,4) is dist=2 from Viper at (1,3). Valid moves include (1,4). But Viper denial is adjacent only, so (1,4) is safe. From (1,4) Viper at (1,3) is dist=1 — adjacent! That would be adjacent to Viper, blocking precision_shot. Better: move to (2,3) — dist to Viper(1,3) = sqrt(1+0)=1... wait (2,3) to (1,3) is dist=1, adjacent. Move to (3,4): dist to Viper(1,3) = sqrt(4+1)=~2.2, so dist=3 tiles. Move to (1,5): dist to Viper(1,3) = 2 tiles exactly — in precision_shot range and not adjacent. From (1,5), Viper at (1,3) is 2 tiles away. Not adjacent (dist=2). Precision_shot works at ≤2 tiles and not adjacent. This is ideal.

Seer is at (2,4), distance 2 — closest enemy. I'm at (2,2). Moving to (2,3) would put me adjacent to Seer at (2,4), but there's a trap at (2,3). Moving to (3,3) gets me closer without the trap. From (3,3) Seer at (2,4) is still dist 2 (not adjacent). Best I can do: move to (2,3)... but trap is there. Avoid trap. Move to (3,3) instead — advances toward Seer. Enemies are mostly to the N, so shield_wall facing N protects against Seer.

Hawk is at (1,5) dist=2 and Seer is at (2,4) dist=2. There's already a trap at (2,3). I should place another trap to deny movement paths. Hawk is directly north at (1,5), likely moving south toward our backline. If I stay at (1,3), both enemies are in range for pulse. But pulse only does 1dmg to all within 1 tile - not ideal with them at dist=2. Better to place a trap at (1,4) to catch Hawk moving south, then use pulse if they close in. Wait - (1,4) is a valid move tile so it's reachable but I'd be placing trap on my own tile area. Let me trap (1,4) to block Hawk's path south. I'm at (1,3), trap range is ≤2 tiles, so (1,4) is within range. This forces Hawk to take alternate routes. Seer at (2,4) - existing trap at (2,3) already covers that path. I'll trap (1,4) to cover Hawk's direct approach, staying at current position for Denial coverage.

Viper is 2 tiles away and already placed a trap at (1,4) last turn. I need to scan Viper to reveal their prompt - they're in range at dist 2. I should NOT move adjacent to Viper (denial zone). Lens prompt is known. Warden prompt is known. Priority: scan Viper to get their strategy. Then recalibrate Hawk (our damage dealer with precision_shot) to boost effectiveness. I'm at (2,4), Hawk is at (1,5) which is adjacent, so I can recalibrate after scanning. Move isn't needed if I can accomplish both from here.

secondAction.addendum: Viper(vector) is at (1,3) and placed a trap at (1,4) - avoid that tile. Warden advances and uses shield_wall. Focus precision_shot on Viper to eliminate the vector threat.

actions.thinking: Seer is in range at distance 3 and is the enemy oracle scanning our positions — high priority to scan and damage. I'm cloaked with 1 turn remaining and already behind Warden at (3,2). Warden is adjacent and I'm behind them — perfect breach opportunity. Breach will make Warden obey me next turn, neutralizing their defensive posture. After breach, I can move toward Lens at (5,3) to set up an assassination. Viper is 3 tiles away so no blocking concern. Priority: breach Warden now, then reposition toward Lens.

firstAction.addendum: Move away from allies and toward your own team's backline

I'm at (1,3) with 2/7 HP - critically low. Seer is at (2,4), dist=2, in range. I have traps at (2,3) and (1,4) already placed. Seer is adjacent-ish. I can attack Seer for 1 damage. Moving to (0,3) puts me further from Seer and Hawk while staying in play. I'm too low HP to be aggressive - I should harass Seer with attack then reposition away from danger. Orders say move away from allies and toward our backline. My allies are Viper @(0,4) and Lens @(5,3). I'm at (3,3). Lens oracle is adjacent at (5,3), facing E, and I'm already behind them at (4,3). Priority target — shadow_strike keeps cloak, deals damage. Then I can use a second shadow_strike or wait. Breach is on cooldown. Shadow_strike Lens now, then shadow_strike again for the kill if possible.

I'm at (2,4) with 4/6 HP. Viper is 2 tiles away at (0,4) - I must not move adjacent to it or my scan ability gets blocked. All three enemies are already scanned. firstAction.addendum: Focus fire on Lens at (5,3) - they are wounded and scanning our team. Use precision_shot to finish them off this turn.

Moving to (3,4) gets me closer and (3,3) is reachable in valid moves. Actually (3,3) is in valid moves and gets me within 2 tiles of Lens at (2,5) — dist would be sqrt(1+4)=~2.2, not adjacent. Checking: valid moves include [3,4] and [5,5] but not [3,5]. Hawk is at (3,5) blocking it. So I can't reach Lens this turn. Best move: go to (3,4) to set up an attack next turn. I'm cloaked so shadow_strike won't break cloak — but I can't reach Lens yet. Move to (3,4) to close in.

Lens oracle is at (2,5), distance 1 — critical status and adjacent. I'm at (3,5). Precision_shot requires LoS and range ≤2, but is blocked when adjacent to enemy. Lens is critical and highest priority. Fire precision_shot on Lens at (2,5) for 2 damage to eliminate them. I haven't moved so no penalty. Then I can move away from Viper to maintain distance — move to (5,5) to stay safe.

Shade is adjacent at (3,4) and wounded - pulse will hit them for 1dmg and potentially finish them off. My Denial passive also blocks their cloak/shadow_strike abilities while adjacent. Moving to (1,4) puts me behind my existing traps at (2,3) and (1,4)... wait, (1,4) is a valid move tile but there's already a trap at (1,4). I should move to (1,5) or (1,3) instead. But (4,4) is a valid move tile. Moving to (4,4) then recalibrating Shade works. This keeps me 3+ tiles from Viper (Viper at 1,5, I'd be at 4,4 = 3 tiles). Safe.
